Dear Sir/Madam,

I, as a Hong-Konger, completely sorry to write this letter to tell, your player “Dai” should not be listed as Hong Kong player.

Due to the recent international duty call, “Dai” had chosen to play for Chinese U21, instead of Hong Kong, which are completely two different nationality. I am deeply disappointed to tell you that please do not list Mr. Dai as Hong Kong. For the moment he chose Chinese team, he shall lose his right to own the British Citizen as well.

Personally would suggest that you can adjust the spelling for “Mr. Dai” from the original Hong Kong style to the following Mandarin style, “Dài WÄ›i Jùn”. As Chinese people are quite sensitive on nationality. If you keep making mistake on Mr. Dài WÄ›i Jùn country and name, that would be a huge political disaster.

King Regards,
Fellaini the Tree

Dear Sir/Madam,

I, as a Hong-Konger, completely sorry to write this letter to tell, your player “Dai” should not be listed as Hong Kong player.

Due to the recent international duty call, “Dai” had chosen to play for Chinese U21, instead of Hong Kong, which are completely two different nationality. I am deeply disappointed to tell you that please do not list Mr. Dai as Hong Kong. For the moment he chose Chinese team, he shall lose his right to own the British Citizen as well.

Personally would suggest that you can adjust the spelling for “Mr. Dai” from the original Hong Kong style to the following Mandarin style, “Dài WÄ›i Jùn”. As Chinese people are quite sensitive on nationality. If you keep making mistake on Mr. Dài WÄ›i Jùn country and name, that would be a huge political disaster.

King Regards,
Fellaini the Tree
